page.title: 14New House Farm
page.content: In this farming area just to the west of Preston there are quite a number of farms.New House Farm was built in 1863.The De Houghtons,the local land owners from Houghton Towers,owned it.Houghton Towers,about 5 miles south east of Preston,is where Charles 1 is supposed to have knighted the joint of beef-sirloin.Mr Tudor has lived on the farm 52 years.He has 30 dairy cattle and 10 beef.Some are friesian,some are hereford,some are mixed.The cows give 120 gallons of milk a day and have to be milked twice.There are 20 pigs and 12 hens.He sells the pigs for bacon but keeps the eggs for his own use.He has got 3 tractors,a baler and a grass cutter.He sends the milk to the Milk Marketing Board.His farm covers 38 acres.
